text: Thomas Howard "Tom" Kean, Sr. (; born April 21, 1935) is an American Republican Party politician. He served as the 48th Governor of New Jersey from 1982 to 1990. ==References== ==Other websites== * Thomas H. Kean biography at 9/11 Commission Official Web Site. * New Jersey Governor Thomas H. Kean biography , National Governors Association. * Governor Tom Kean , a biography by Alvin S. Felzenberg, Rutgers University Press. * "A View from Outside the Beltway: Winning Policy Themes for the 1990s" , by Thomas Kean, Heritage Lecture No. 357, Heritage Foundation, December 15, 1991. * "9/11 Panel Suspected Deception by Pentagon", The Washington Post, August 2, 2006. * "Stonewalled by the C.I.A.", op-ed by Kean and Lee H. Hamilton, The New York Times, January 2, 2008. * . * The Thomas H. Kean Archive, Rutgers Program on the Governor Category:1935 births Category:Living people Category:Columbia University alumni Category:Governors of New Jersey Category:Politicians from New York City Category:Princeton University alumni Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Thomas Kean
